definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Hope that the United States will abandon the Cold War mentality, not in Hongkong to engage in political gamesmanship.
sentences.chinese: 希望美方摒棄冷戰思維，不在香港搞政治上的小動作。

sentences.english: The child often plays in class.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子上課愛搞小動作。

sentences.english: I like your small gestures that speak volumes about how much you care.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡你的那些小動作，它們告訴我你有多在乎我。

sentences.english: And remember, building intrigue and anticipation is not a task that you need to do with techniques.
sentences.chinese: 且記住，搞點小動作並不需要高明的技術。

sentences.english: C. a. n. a. d. a----Cute and naughty action developed into attraction.
sentences.chinese: 可愛和頑皮的小動作形成吸引力。

sentences.english: Fidgeting is a clear sign of nervousness.
sentences.chinese: 做小動作是一種很明顯的焦慮信號。

sentences.english: It was a pose he often took when awaiting measures of peaceful reconciliation with Kaname, post-argument.
sentences.chinese: 這個小動作常常表示他在爭吵後期待着與小要和好。

sentences.english: However, this small action, has long been the Tang Dynasty discover the minutest detail in everything.
sentences.chinese: 可是，這點小動作，早已被唐朝明察秋毫了。

sentences.english: Shut up, Fool, you spin ain't genuine.
sentences.chinese: 閉嘴，你個蠢材，你那些小動作動機都不純。

definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
